engine_phase: PHASE 2 — Execution Support. First PURSUE issued Cycle 10. Engine transitions from pure analysis to monitoring, operational intelligence, and continued pipeline development.

founding_conditions.starting_capital: $500K-$1M, can raise more if opportunity merits
founding_conditions.founder_1: operator, Argentina citizen, US resident, English+Spanish
founding_conditions.founder_2: ML/AI Masters Georgia Tech, US citizen
founding_conditions.operating_geo: US primary, operate FROM US with international intelligence. Not relocating — using comparative data to confirm/challenge US-centric analytical biases.
founding_conditions.credentials: no CPA/JD/MD — willing to acquire licensed businesses
founding_conditions.languages: English+Spanish native, others = cost adder not blocker
founding_conditions.optimization_target: opportunity quality + VC differentiation, NOT capital fit

history.reason: Post Cycle 3: themes established, need depth over novelty. Boost data specificity for unit economics verification. Boost cross-signal reinforcement to detect convergences.
Post Cycle 6 counter-signal revolution: added counter_signal_severity (1.5) and competitive_density (1.3) as permanent grading dimensions.

Post Cycle 8: added market_price_confirmation (1.1) as grading dimension. When equity markets (staffing stocks, sector ETFs) confirm or contradict a thesis, this should modestly adjust scores. Weight is conservative (1.1) because market signals can be noisy — the staffing canary is unusually clean and direct.

running_patterns.description: P2+P5 Divergence Corridor: Professional services in liquidation cascade while healthcare faces permanent labor shortage
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: Pattern continues at full strength. Professional labor substitution confirmed by staffing canary no-recovery. Healthcare divergence persists. This pattern is the macro foundation for the Customer Support PURSUE.

running_patterns.description: P2+P3 Credit-Squeeze Accelerator: Falling credit availability preventing incumbent restructuring while AI entrants need minimal capital
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: Capital Environment at 100.0 for third consecutive cycle. The credit squeeze phase (2024-2025) is over. Capital is flowing. But the damage to incumbents who needed capital during the squeeze is permanent. For AI-native entrants, conditions are maximally favorable.

running_patterns.description: P1+P3 Cost Floor Unlock: 1000x inference cost collapse enabling new tier of agentic businesses
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: P3 at 100.0 for third consecutive cycle. This is not a transient spike — it is a new structural reality. The cost of AI inference continues to fall. This directly enables the Customer Support unit economics (AI handles 65% at $0.50/ticket). The cost floor unlock IS the business model.

running_patterns.description: P7 Timing Arbitrage: Companies cutting human capacity before AI can deliver, creating service vacuums
running_patterns.status: confirmed — market-priced, sector-specific, DROVE FIRST PURSUE
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: P7 timing arbitrage is the OPERATIVE THESIS behind the Customer Support PURSUE. The vacuum between 'companies cutting humans' and 'AI cannot fully replace them' is the market entry window. Agent B estimates this window at 10-16 months (tighter than Agent C's 12-18). Urgency is real.

running_patterns.description: PE Roll-Up Vulnerability: PE firms deploying $200B+ into fragmented sector roll-ups may face Minsky distress as AI disruption outpaces their restructuring capacity
running_patterns.status: emerging — monitoring for PE stress signals
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: No new PE stress signals detected this cycle. Staffing canary continues to suggest PE roll-ups in professional services may be overpaying for depreciating labor assets. Monitoring continues but this is not a prioritized research direction while Customer Support execution takes focus.

running_patterns.description: Competitive Density as Universal Gate: Every sector flagged by the Principles Engine has already attracted $1B+ in VC/PE. The framework's strength is also its weakness — obvious disruption is obvious to everyone.
running_patterns.status: confirmed — TWO EXCEPTIONS found (vet service layer, customer support service layer)
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: The Universal Gate thesis remains valid but Cycle 10 has found its second exception. The three-layer competitive framework reveals that customer support SERVICE layer is sparse (<$500M) even though tool layer is saturated ($5B+). Combined with veterinary services (<$100M), the engine now has TWO sectors that pass the density gate — both requiring domain-specific analysis that generic pattern recognition misses. This validates the original P-006 insight: the search must focus on sectors where domain-specific insight creates the entry.

running_patterns.description: Staffing Canary as Macro Leading Indicator: Staffing company equity prices collapse 6-12 months before government employment data confirms structural labor shifts. The gradient (RHI -51% vs KELYA -20%) reveals professional-specific disruption.
running_patterns.status: confirmed — no recovery, awaiting BLS/JOLTS validation Q2-Q3 2026
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: Staffing canary shows NO recovery after multiple quarters. Persistence strengthens the structural interpretation. If BLS/JOLTS data confirms structural decline in Q2-Q3 2026, the canary becomes a validated predictive instrument. This is the engine's most reliable market-priced signal.

running_patterns.description: Composite Index Convergence at Maximum: P3 Cost Collapse and Capital Environment both at 100.0 simultaneously, creating the most favorable macro setup for AI-native business formation — but also potentially flooding all sectors with competitive capital.
running_patterns.status: confirmed — THIRD CONSECUTIVE CYCLE at maximum
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: Third consecutive cycle at double-maximum. The density feedback fear (P-006: everyone sees favorable conditions -> everyone enters -> density kills opportunity) has NOT materialized. Creative Destruction Index remains near 0 — entrepreneurs are NOT forming businesses despite maximum conditions. The window remains uncrowded. This may be the single most important macro signal: maximum conditions + minimum competitive entry = widest window.

running_patterns.description: Three-Layer Competitive Framework: Tool layer, incumbent service layer, and AI-native service layer are structurally distinct markets with different density profiles. Tool saturation does NOT equal service saturation.
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: First validated in Cycle 10 with customer support data. The framework resolved the 2-cycle-old service layer density question and directly enabled the PURSUE verdict. Should be applied as standard competitive analysis for all future opportunities. The key insight: when scanning competitive density, specify WHICH layer is being assessed. A sector that appears crowded at the tool level may be sparse at the service level.

running_patterns.description: BPO Structural Inversion Barrier: BPO incumbents with 300K+ workforces, headcount-based contracts, and human-operations DNA cannot invert to AI-first model within 12-24 months without self-disruption. Classic innovator's dilemma at industry scale.
running_patterns.status: NEW — key thesis support for Customer Support PURSUE
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: The inversion barrier is the structural foundation of the Customer Support opportunity's competitive moat. BPO firms adding AI to human-first operations (AI augmentation) is fundamentally different from building AI-first with human escalation (AI inversion). The cost structure difference is 2-3x. The inversion barrier provides the 12-24 month window for AI-first entrants to establish market position.

running_patterns.description: Hidden Density: Incumbent AI Adoption as competitive density metric alongside startup funding. Engine's startup-focused density scan misses incumbent AI investment.
running_patterns.status: NEW — requires recalibration of density scans
running_patterns.cycle_10_note: Agent C's cross-domain hypothesis testing revealed this blind spot. The engine has been measuring competitive density via startup/VC funding deployed. But density also forms through incumbent AI adoption, which the startup scan misses. For Customer Support: BPO AI adoption is the medium-term threat (not startup entry). For Vet: IDEXX AI diagnostics features are distinct from practice ops but worth monitoring. The engine should add 'incumbent AI adoption rate' as a density metric in future cycles.

pursue.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler — Managed Hybrid Human+AI
pursue.status_history: Cycle 7: scanning (58) -> Cycle 8: co-#1 (65) -> Cycle 9: #1 INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (66) -> Cycle 10: PURSUE (72)
execution_milestones: Build MVP AI support pipeline (30 days)
Sign 2-3 pilot SaaS mid-market customers at $5K-10K/month (90 days)
Track AI resolution rate and customer satisfaction (ongoing)
Gross margin must exceed 35% by month 6
Prepare VC materials for seed round (6 months)

investigate_further.name: Veterinary Services — Agentic Practice Operations
investigate_further.status_history: Cycle 7: scanning (62) -> Cycle 8: co-#1 (65) -> Cycle 9: #2 INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (60) -> Cycle 10: INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (62)
path_to_pursue: Customer discovery: 5-10 vet practice owner conversations
Archy competitive intelligence: penetration, product scope, growth
Domain advisor recruitment or domain-agnostic GTM thesis

investigate_further.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker — NAICS 425120
investigate_further.status_history: Cycle 9: NEW (55) -> Cycle 10: INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (53, PARK WARNING)
investigate_further.park_trigger: No customer discovery by Cycle 12 confirming transactional (not relationship-sticky) broker dynamics. OR Knowde >5% market penetration in commodity chemicals.

methodology_tracking.key_finding_cycle_9: Engine had only ONE discovery method (LLM brainstorming) which exhausted after Cycle 3. Adding bottom-up screener immediately produced 3 new pipeline candidates. Thompson Sampling allocation ensures future cycles systematically try untested methods.
methodology_tracking.key_finding_cycle_10: IO table propagation (first application, previously 0) produced 2 new pipeline candidates (trade finance, commercial insurance) AND the land-and-expand chain for Customer Support. Shift-share decomposition first conceptual application confirmed US-specificity. Cross-domain hypothesis testing (5/6 productive) is the highest-value analytical method this cycle. All previously-untested methods have now been trialed at least once.
methodology_tracking.exploration_budget: 20% of cycle capacity reserved for methods with < 3 applications
methods_trialed_cycle_10: io_table_propagation (FIRST APPLICATION — produced 2 candidates + expansion chain)
cross_domain_hypothesis_testing (6 tested, 5 productive — triple convergence strongest)
methodology_tracking.all_methods_status: All previously-untested methods have been trialed at least once. Future exploration budget should focus on deepening productive methods (IO propagation, cross-domain testing) rather than trialing new ones.

agent_a.kill_index_hit_rate: 14.2% (6/42 signals matched kill patterns in Cycle 10)
agent_a.notes: Cycle 10 Agent A+C expanded methodology significantly. IO table propagation produced genuine novel candidates. Cross-domain hypothesis testing at 5/6 productive rate is the highest-value analytical method available. Unit economics modeling for Customer Support provided the data specificity needed for PURSUE.

agent_b.pursue_rate: 5.9% (1 PURSUE out of 17 total verifications across all cycles)
common_kill_reasons: Regulatory prohibition of core value proposition
Incumbent moat + proven startup failure pattern
Category shrinking (staffing — no entry point even with disruption thesis)
agent_b.notes: Cycle 10 Agent B issued its FIRST PURSUE verdict after 9 cycles of zero approvals. The PURSUE was issued with 3-point discount (75->72) reflecting legitimate concerns: tighter timing window (10-16 months vs 12-18), temporary LATAM moat, speculative TAM expansion, and quality/churn risks. Agent B's aggressive filtering (82% kill+park rate) provides confidence that when a PURSUE is issued, it has been rigorously tested. Veterinary advanced +2 (from 60 to 62), Wholesale decreased -2 (from 55 to 53 with PARK WARNING).

criteria: 1. No identified kill-level barrier (regulatory prohibition, precedent failure at 100x+ capital, or competitive density >$500M in target layer)
2. Positive unit economics model with gross margins >30% at estimated scale
3. Sparse competitive density (<$500M) in the specific market layer being targeted
4. Confirmed timing window (>6 months before window closes)
5. Founder fit: team can execute without credentials they don't have
6. Beachhead identified: specific customer segment for initial traction
7. Cross-signal reinforcement: at least 2 independent analytical methods support the thesis
pursue_threshold_criteria.note: Established in Cycle 10 to formalize the standard that had been implicit. Customer Support meets all 7 criteria. Veterinary meets 5/7 (missing unit economics validation and cross-signal reinforcement). Wholesale meets 3/7.

critical_risks_to_monitor.risk: Sierra AI pivots to managed mid-market service
critical_risks_to_monitor.impact: SEVERE — directly competes with Customer Support PURSUE
critical_risks_to_monitor.monitoring: Track Sierra AI blog, press releases, job postings quarterly

critical_risks_to_monitor.risk: Autonomous AI agents mature faster than expected
critical_risks_to_monitor.impact: MODERATE — compresses window but also improves hybrid provider's AI layer
critical_risks_to_monitor.monitoring: Track GPT-5, Claude 5, Gemini Ultra performance benchmarks monthly
critical_risks_to_monitor.trigger_action: Pivot hybrid model ratio from 65/35 to 90/10 AI/human

critical_risks_to_monitor.risk: Mars acquires Archy, closing veterinary window
critical_risks_to_monitor.monitoring: Track Mars Petcare M&A announcements quarterly

key_unknowns: EXECUTION: Can the founding team build an MVP AI support pipeline, recruit LATAM agents, and sign pilot customers within 90 days? The thesis is analytical — execution may reveal problems desk research cannot detect.
TIMING: Is the 10-16 month window before BPO inversion and autonomous AI maturation accurate? Could be shorter (8-12 months) or longer (18-24 months). Monthly monitoring required.
ARCHY: What is Archy's actual market penetration in vet PIMS? If >5% of 33K practices, the beachhead may be occupied. Critical for Veterinary Services advancement to PURSUE.
WHOLESALE RELATIONSHIPS: Are commodity chemical broker-client relationships transactional or sticky? This is the K-004 distinction question. Only customer discovery can answer it.

BLS/JOLTS VALIDATION: Will government employment data confirm the staffing canary signal in Q2-Q3 2026? If confirmed, the canary becomes a validated predictive instrument. If not, equity markets may have overreacted.
HIDDEN DENSITY: How rapidly are BPO incumbents adding AI capabilities? The engine's startup-focused density scan misses this. Need to develop incumbent AI adoption rate as a metric.
QUALITY AT SCALE: Can AI-first hybrid support maintain quality standards acceptable to SaaS mid-market companies? Even one bad interaction in a high-reputation community could damage growth.

TRADE FINANCE + COMMERCIAL INSURANCE: Are the IO-propagation-identified pipeline candidates (NAICS 522390, 524126) sparse in competitive density? Low priority but tests whether IO propagation systematically discovers opportunities.
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1 — EXECUTION: Customer Support Vacuum Filler. Stop analyzing, start building. Build MVP. Recruit LATAM agents. Sign pilot customers. Engine shifts to monitoring and operational intelligence.
PRIORITY 2: Veterinary Services customer discovery. 5-10 vet practice owner conversations. Archy competitive intelligence. Domain advisor recruitment. Target PURSUE by Cycle 12.
PRIORITY 3: Wholesale Trade decision point. Customer discovery (3-5 chemical broker interviews) or PARK. No discovery by Cycle 12 = PARK by default.
PRIORITY 4: Monitor critical risks R-001 (Sierra AI), R-002 (autonomous agents), R-003 (Mars/Archy). Quarterly cadence.
PRIORITY 5: Scan IO-propagation candidates (trade finance, commercial insurance) for competitive density. Low priority — do not distract from execution.
PRIORITY 6: Boutique Consulting kill decision by Cycle 12. If no standardized vertical identified, escalate to K-008.
PRIORITY 7: Add incumbent AI adoption rate as density metric alongside startup funding deployed.
MONITOR: Staffing canary quarterly (RHI, MAN, KELYA). BLS/JOLTS validation expected Q2-Q3 2026.
MONITOR: PE roll-up health (Crete, Ascend, Accrual). Low priority but staffing canary may predict stress.

PROCESS: Engine transitions from Phase 1 (analysis/filtering) to Phase 2 (execution support + continued pipeline development). Primary output shifts from opportunity recommendations to operational intelligence.
